lines.text: What if I had your brother's name tattooed by my deal, a sex reminder every time you went to fool with me? That's how I live every day of my life, rain or shine.
A rose is just a symbol that represents a flower called a rose. And you oughta be damned proud that I covered her name up with a feather that way, 'cause I done it for you. Out of love.
Bullshit! I stayed on your ass is the only reason you fixed any of it. And the only reason you got that one means *God* is to take my attention off *her* being all over you!
I didn't necessarily say it meant God. That one guy in there said it meant God, the other guy said it's a weed whacker, or a Communist flag, or something. And they don't believe in God. Or Jesus.
I like to be up when there ain't nobody else up. Feels like the whole world's asleep. Can't nuthin' get ya or bother ya. Ya know?
Well, it seems to me that's when everything *can* get you. That's when folks get knocked in the head, and shot, cut up and everything, at night.
I don't want to think about things like that right now. If your gonna keep talkin' about it, you'll have to sleep on the couch.
Yeah, I got in a lot of trouble in France.
[chuckles]
That's where I did most of my fighting, military-wise. But I kicked up my heels a time to two. What, uh, what war did you lose your legs in?
I ain't old enough to be in no war, except the Gulf.
Oh, that wasn't no war. Just a bunch of missiles shootin'.
My ex-wife shot me in the back.
Didn't even shoot 'em by hand, they used computers. One old boy broadcast it on the news from up under a bed.

[in a neck brace]
I can't have a head-on collision in peace! I coulda been torn to pieces here.
Yeah, well, you have fun at your little nightclub?
Well, shit, we didn't get to the nightclub. We ain't but a mile from the house. We was headed that way, and J.C. bent down to pick up his Molly Hatchet tape, and we been here ever since.
Alvin busted in on me in the toilet tonight while I was doin' lumber.
I'm sorry, sugar.
I guess it's okay, he's my brother.
It's kinda like that book they had us read one time in school. It started out sayin' it was the best time I ever had, and it was the worst time I ever had. I believe it's by Dick somebody.
I'll be dogged.
So I've been puttin' up with all that shit from daddy all these years about grand babies, and I been shootin' at a steel door.
[last lines]
Some clouds comin' in. Maybe there's a storm comin'.
Nah, them ain't storm clouds.
